tom-waits,,Default,configurable,"Default Category/Music,Default Category/Popular Culture",base,Tom Waits,"

This t-shirt design is one of a series in admiration of Tom Waits.

column3: >Tom Waits to me, is like the barker standing outside a freak show in the American middle of nowhere.
>He invites you to come inside and marvel at the oddities on display. Each one is an aspect of his life
column4: a thought he had on the way to somewhere else, a memory from his childhood, a feeling, someone he used to know. The freaks are his songs, and his songs are himself.

column3: >""Somebody once said I'm not a musician but a tonal engineer. I like that, Its kind of clinical and primitive at the same time.""

>I think this quote sums up Waits completely. His style is well honed and skilled, but the delivery is like getting smashed in the skull with a blunt instrument. He is also like an 18th century Barber Surgeon. He knows exactly what he's doing, but he doesn't wash his hands before he operates.

>This is a good one too:

""I'd rather have a bottle in front of me than a frontal lobotomy""

>I admire Tom Waits so have created this Tom Waits t-shirt in his honour.
